Reviews.Title: “Met our needs just fine”
Reviews.Author: psa64
Reviews.Content: We had home repairs last weekend so had to vacate. We wanted an affordable, close-to-home, spot with Wi-Fi and breakfast. Howard Johnson El Cajon Blvd delivered. Quiet, secure, and comfortable. Not the Ritz, but just right for our needs. Across the street from a Rite-Aid and just a couple of blocks from new buffet ($8.99 lunch + 25% senior discount). Front office and housekeeping staff quite cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Run from it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bruno M
Reviews.Content: We booked this one on line but when we got there.... HUGE disappointment!!! .... The room (even with a non-smoking sign at the door) smelled reallyyy bad....We were forced to buy an aerosol to disguise it a little bit. Lots and lots of stains on the carpet.... Not really a continental breakfast as they advertises.... Sums up, not a good experience at all.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: brian r
Reviews.Content: bring your gun you will need it , also no sleep people at all hours of the night coming and going,also this place is like camping, not really camping would be cleaner really do not go here

Reviews.Title: “Needed a damned good clean”
Reviews.Author: wahili
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Usually stay next door at the Best Western Lamplighter, but they were full. Whole place has an air of neglect about it. We were given a small discount on the room rate because the AC was not working when we arrived. Front desk guy suggested that engineer was due to fix it, but he never arrived. We were given a desk fan instead. We arrived just as the room was being made up, which enabled me to see the bed stripped down. The bed looked OK, but the pillows were yellow. The maid looked surprised when I asked for clean ones, but she complied. Our room was not very clean. The bathroom door frame looked like it hadn't been cleaned for years - thick with the type of black dust that you get around door frames. Glanced down the back of the unit housing the TV and it was thick with cobwebs. The carpet was filthy. Bed was comfortable enough, but having seen the state of the pillows that were replaced, couldn't help but wonder what I was sleeping on. Rate included breakfast which was no more than a selection of pastries in a box, coffee and juice, served in the small main lobby. Everything about this place screams "cheap and nasty". Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: MellieM
Reviews.Content: I rate this as poor, but it is real close to terrible. It is extremely poor to other Howard Johnson's I have stayed at. $59.99 per night Thought I had found a great deal. Just walked in the door and it stinks of smoke. The beds are so hard I could use them as a table to eat from. The toilet stuck and I had to fix it, cause it was continuously running. The pool looked much larger in the pic, but that is fine for the moment. The pic of the rooms are very deceiving. They look nice in the pics and the rooms looked bigger than they are. We got 2 very small pillows. There are light bulbs that need to be replaced. There are smudges on the walls and they have missing paint. The ceiling has black mold on it. I was told by the operator that Sea World was real close. But it is quite far away. You have to go through the college parking lot to get from the hotel to Sea World. Sadly this is not what I was expecting. I just hope the one near Disneyland is better than this. We came for a nice visit and a relaxing time hoping to have a nice place to stay. I can say a few real nice things about this hotel. It has a huge fridge and has a safety box. I really hope the breakfast is as good as the operator said it was. I am not sure who cleans these rooms, but maybe they need to spend just a few more min dust off the old spider webs off the ceiling and dusting the counter space. The carpet needs to be vacuumed a bit better and I know there is a spray that gets rid of pet and smoke smells. Maybe they need to invest into some. I have stayed in places costing the same and they were much nicer that this. You often get what you pay for. The hotel was cheap and shoddy for the price we paid. Could have had a better room at hotel 6 or 8. We have paid $40 there and they have always shown to be at least average if not better on all occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: FSL_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night before visiting the University. The place is quiet, clean, simple and friendly. They offer a small swimming pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do this”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very upset with service cleanliness rooms and all the rest I changed hotels after being there for 1 night 2 best western what's right next door

Reviews.Title: “No for tourists, there is much better elseware.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked into Hojo for 4 nights and stayed 1. - Staff were fine. Not entirely warming though. - Room was basic and v. dated. Has TV, wifi, fridge, microwave what you would expect. - Local area was poor. No attractions. 20 mins drive from Downtown, Point Loma and Gaslamp. - Okay for 1 night, but locals suggested the area is dangerous and we smelt marijuana strongly from our rooms. - Bathroom window was not secure so we felt unsafe. - San Diego is beautiful, go somewhere else and you'll appreciate it much more!

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be there”
Reviews.Author: knakker
Reviews.Content: The employees of the hotel were very polite and where always happy to assist whereever they could.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent option to stay”
Reviews.Author: rakeshmasna
Reviews.Content: This motel is superb option to stay. This is very near (just 1mile) to San Diego state university.Great neighborhood.It is too closer to Starbucks,subway and other restaurants.Great Value to the price what i paid.The room was equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, tv, hairdryer, iron, ironing board, free WI-FI, huge parking pace, swimming pool and a safe(No charge). I stayed with my parents in this motel from may 23 to may 25 for my graduation walk in San Diego state university.Our room quality and cleanness was superb.Front desk staff was really good.They really took care of me and my parents.I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “No frills place -budget friendly”
Reviews.Author: cerenikov
Reviews.Content: Great location on El Cajon Ave., the rooms are shady and in poor condition. I believe it's overpriced as I stayed in Travelodge La Mesa (8 min drive from Howard Johnson) which is far more superior, for the same price! Although if I had to, I wouldn't mind staying at Howard Johnson. If you walk in, you can bargain a better deal (not a lot) with the Indian guy.

Reviews.Title: “Looking to feel like a cheap [--]...”
Reviews.Author: Eyetravel1990
Reviews.Content: This is the place you want to stay if you want to feel nasty, dirty, and like a cheap [--]. The neighborhood is fine. Starbucks down the street and other eateries. I mention Starbuck's because the continential breakfast and coffee was not desirable. First, let's say the night staff is friendly, but the check out clerk was a little cranky. My fiance and I planned a little get away from our children, but the getaway turned into a night mare. If it wsn't for the fact that I was with the man I love I would have been utterly disappointed. Secondly, The rooms we were given were smelly. They smelled of mildew, funk, and porta potty after the "number 2". The bed was even worse, but it was just the comforter. After removing the comforter, the sheets were okay. Third, the heater was a switch (a light switch) and a huge unit which over powered the space that it occupied. It had a cord which was taped together with electrical tape. I was afraid to turn it on, but I was not willing to freeze. Finally, the shower...it took almost 30 minutes for the shower to get to a decent temperature to even attempt to put your body in. The tub was yellow stained and the towels were crispy. They felt like they were laundered by hand and line dried. Overall, if you want to stay at a nasty, grungy, smelly place have at it, here is the hotel for you. I would not recommend this hotel to my enemy (maybe, I would). HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE:(

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: TotallyDisgusted1
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute worse hotel I have stayed at ever. The room was filthy. The carpets and walls stained. The TV had poor reception on all channels. The tub was stained too. When I first arrived the A/C didn't work and when I called the front desk, the manager argued. He finally came up and played with the controls and said it working. He would not admit it was not cooling. He argued for several minutes. The A/C had been on for 20 minutes and the room was sweltering. I told him to move me or I was going to another hotel. He finally did but the second room was in as bad shape as the first! Believe me, stay away. This place should be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, dirty, avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: stonewallheir
Reviews.Content: This hotel smelled, was unbelievably dirty and the manager automatically charges you an extra $1.50 for a safe rental, without telling you in advance. We never used the safe and did not notice the fee until we left the hotel (we could not get out of that dump fast enough!). We called, on principle about the safe fee, and the manager said he charges everyone for a safe unless you tell him not to. We said he should not do that, or at least have a sign up at check-in desk the hotel will be doing that. He ended up telling me to [--] and hung up. The bedding, carpet and towels were all very old and very used. I checked under the bed to make sure I left nothing under there, and I wish I hadn't! The mattress lining was all torn up and there was a thick layer of dust/dirt and misc. debris under the bed. It must not have been moved or cleaned in years! I shuddered at the thought of breathing in such contaminants! All in all, a very bad neighborhood, inconvienient location and extremely poorly run hotel. A Motel 6 would seem like a palace in comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Austate
Reviews.Content: Located in the hotel circle area of San Diego. Great value property. The room was equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, tv, hairdryer, iron, and a safe all for under $80 including tax.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with poor parking”
Reviews.Author: Pakkoku
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days after Christmas. On the plus side, the staff were extremely nice, and the rooms featured spacious small refrigerators and new microwaves. The hotel also has free wifi. On the down side, the hotel itself it a bit rundown. The featured continental breakfast was only coffee, cereal, and pastries (the juice machine was not working and there were no breakfast items that weren't mostly sugar). Inside the rooms, there were no available electrical outlets, and we had to unplug the light fixtures to be able to charge cell phones and computers. The rooms feature large windows that open onto the parking lot and admit a lot of street noise (more than what I would consider usual). The parking lot has very small spaces; when parked you can't open your doors wide enough to take out luggage. My rental was dinged on both sides during my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had seen the previous reviews - stay away really!”
Reviews.Author: AZHeat200
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us booked 2 rooms for 2 nights in July, San Diego's busy season. Only stayed 1 night because we had to. Couldn't get out fast enough. We paid $79.90 per room. I wouldn't stay for free. DISCUSTING, stains, dirty sock left in drawer. lighter under bed (of no smoking room), dirty sheets, pool & area was was dirty. There was a latex glove on the ground by pool. Cans on ground. Had to get the manager out of bed the next morning at 8 am so we could check out. And that continental breakfast, Ha! Stale donuts, coffee wasn't made. DO NOT STAY HERE! Howard Johnson shame on you.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare.... Stay Else Where”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: all i can say is that this is the wosrt hotel that i have stayed at in my life. from the manager to the desk clerks to the room. first the manager and deskclerks were just ignoring me while i was in the office, they were talkin amongst themsleves, which was very rude.... also the one desk clerk seemed scary and seemed like he was drinking because he smelt of it and also he didnt know what was really going on, i also saw bottles on the desk near the computer that he was entering my information in. i am sure you cant drink on the job. the manager had a big attitude when i was asking a few questions about the area, he and the desk clerk were using words like "--- and crap" when telling me about other hotels in the area... ( well guess what i think they were talking about there own place) the rooms were bad also, i cant believe the state of these rooms. what do these people think there doing there, if they cant run a hotel properly. i will never staye here againa nd i hope no one else does also. this place is going to be run down before we know it. they seriously need to get there act together.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: GRTraveller
Reviews.Content: In Feb 2002 while on a Disneyland trip we decided to visit San Diego for an evening. Since we were staying at the Howard Johnson Inn at Disneyland (a great hotel by the way and one we would definately recommend) we thought we would make a reservation for the HoJo in San Diego. Can't go wrong right? Wrong. BIG MISTAKE. Man were we ever shocked when we stepped into our room. We were expecting a nice, clean, room similar to the HoJo we just came from in LA, it was the complete opposite - it was dirty, smelly, dingy, etc. Who would have thought that a hotel chain like HoJo would have two very different classes of hotel. Other than returning to the HoJo near Disneyland I don't think we will be checking into another HoJo anywhere else. It may be just the SD location, but as the saying goes, once bitten, twice shy.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Driving... Not Worth It! (Stay Away From This One)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, first off, I arrived in San Diego a day early, we drove from Northern California and we did not think we would make it the entire way. But we did. We had reservations at the Radisson in Downtown San Diego but for an extra night it would be almost $300. My family and I decided to stay somewhere out of town outside of the main area. Bad decision. The hotel itself is worse than a Motel 6. I would have been better off staying in Hotel Circle. The manager is hard to understand but polite and we had no problems getting a room without reservations. When I checked into the room the overall first impression was OK, nothing more. Standard crappy little motel for the night. Understandable. The beds were OK for a motel, very soft. The television worked without any problems. One major problem was the incredibly disgusting stench that was inside the room, luckily we ha a Glade Plugin, it was bearable for a night but it definitely smelled. The bathroom had serious issues, more specifically the toilet. It looked like someone tried to pull it from the ground, when being used it felt like you were rattling around on a rollercoaster. By all means I would say without a doubt that it is a safety hazard. During our stay we discovered that someone at one time tried to break into the room because the door frame was pulled away. The so called continental breakfast is an even bigger joke, it consisted of milk, coffee, tea, and stale cereal and even older donuts that looked like they were from 7-Eleven. All in all the motel provided us with a one night stay, we tried to stay out of the room as much as possible and left as early as we could. I would recommend staying at a Motel 6 (and there is one near by).

Reviews.Title: “Very dissatisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was extremely dissatisfied with my stay at this hotel. The room was filled with a musky body odor funk that was coming from the comforter of one of two beds. After buying some air freshener we were able to wrangle the smell somewhat. We then looked to the non-smelly bed to find that there were bloodstains anda fresh scab on the topsheet. We swtiched that sheet out for the topsheet of the smelly bed (somehow the top sheet was miraculously devoid of the smell that infested the conmforter. And just when we thought it couldn't get worse, some of the towels were discovered to have unidentifiable yellow stains. If this is what you're looking for, then come on down.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room smelled like a sweaty old man; the sheets were not clean and stained, the towels were stained or dirty. I wanted to go home! I stayed at the Howard Johnson on Hotel Circle, and it is MUCH better. The El Cajon HoJo needs help!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty, broken, disgusting, rude front desk. Stay Away!

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Inn - San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 6440 El Cajon Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92115
